If, for only a moment, you let your guard down and hear a sound—unidentified and quiet—maybe it was all in your head.Never let your guard down.
author: Mandi Lynn, Essence

quote: from the prose poem "The Universe Thrums on regardless" in my book SPAN.We are almost nothing in the night. Reduced to warm blobs and the sound of breathing. There is comfort in that.
author: Jay Woodman, SPAN
category: breathing, comfort, night, nothing, poetry, prose-poem

quote: You are very much lovable, that even dreaming you every night is not repeated.
author: M.F. Moonzajer, A moment with God ; Poetry

quote: We must take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silent encourages the tormentor, never the tormented.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: Life is very tough and fragile at the same time, it never backs down or surrenders, but will break open to reveal its beauty and ugliness. As a evening primrose that blooms in the flooding moonlight, just before being trampled upon underfoot by the four-legged frost of the night.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: beauty, change, flooding, flower, fragile, frost, life, night, primrose, surrender, trampled, ugliness

quote: Try to be a whole person. Not just a night person, or a day person. Be the kind of person who can live in both.
author: Regina Doman, The Midnight Dancers

quote: Oh, I don't wonder babies always cry when they wake up in the night. So often I want to do it too.
author: L.M. Montgomery, Emily's Quest

quote: I realized I still had my eyes shut. I had shut them when I put my face to the screen, like I was scared to look outside. Now I had to open them. I looked out the window and saw for the first time how the hospital was out in the country. The moon was low in the sky over the pastureland; the face of it was scarred and scuffed where it had just torn up out of the snarl of scrub oak and madrone trees on the horizon. The stars up close to the moon were pale; they got brighter and braver the farther they got out of the circle of light ruled by the giant moon. It called to mind how I noticed the exact same thing when I was off on a hunt with Papa and the uncles and I lay rolled in blankets Grandma had woven, lying off a piece from where the men hunkered around the fire as they passed a quart jar of cactus liquor in a silent circle. I watched that big Oregon prairie moon above me put all the stars around it to shame. I kept awake watching, to see if the moon ever got dimmer or if the stars got brighter, till the dew commenced to drift onto my cheeks and I had to pull a blanket over my head. Something moved on the grounds down beneath my window — cast a long spider of shadow out across the grass as it ran out of sight behind a hedge. When it ran back to where I could get a better look, I saw it was a dog, a young, gangly mongrel slipped off from home to find out about things went on after dark. He was sniffing digger squirrel holes, not with a notion to go digging after one but just to get an idea what they were up to at this hour. He’d run his muzzle down a hole, butt up in the air and tail going, then dash off to another. The moon glistened around him on the wet grass, and when he ran he left tracks like dabs of dark paint spattered across the blue shine of the lawn. Galloping from one particularly interesting hole to the next, he became so took with what was coming off — the moon up there, the night, the breeze full of smells so wild makes a young dog drunk — that he had to lie down on his back and roll. He twisted and thrashed around like a fish, back bowed and belly up, and when he got to his feet and shook himself a spray came off him in the moon like silver scales. He sniffed all the holes over again one quick one, to get the smells down good, then suddenly froze still with one paw lifted and his head tilted, listening. I listened too, but I couldn’t hear anything except the popping of the window shade. I listened for a long time. Then, from a long way off, I heard a high, laughing gabble, faint and coming closer. Canada honkers going south for the winter. I remembered all the hunting and belly-crawling I’d ever done trying to kill a honker, and that I never got one. I tried to look where the dog was looking to see if I could find the flock, but it was too dark. The honking came closer and closer till it seemed like they must be flying right through the dorm, right over my head. Then they crossed the moon — a black, weaving necklace, drawn into a V by that lead goose. For an instant that lead goose was right in the center of that circle, bigger than the others, a black cross opening and closing, then he pulled his V out of sight into the sky once more. I listened to them fade away till all I could hear was my memory of the sound.
author: Ken Kesey, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

quote: Now, money, for the night is coming. Money for my hair, money for my teeth, money for shoes that won't deform my feet (it's not so easy now to walk around in cheap shoes with very high heels), money for good clothes, money, money. The night is coming.
author: Jean Rhys, Good Morning, Midnight

quote: The light from his torch painted the barren forest in shades of his own reflection, black-haired, gray-eyed and pale for want of a touch. He pulled his cloak close, unable to determine which made him more uncomfortable: the dreary woods or the new moon settling onto his heart like a cloud of moths.
author: F.T. McKinstry, Water Dark

quote: I've always felt that distant train whistles heard in the dead of night are the universe's way of letting us know the best days are neither ahead nor behind us...they're happening right now, cradled in the palms of our hands. But that doesn't change the fact that the whiskey, weed, and romance eventually runs out and the night will soon turn to day.
author: Dave Matthes, Sleepeth Not, the Bastard
category: booze, daydreaming, death, history, innocence, love, moon, music, night, romance, trains, weed, whiskey, whistles

quote: Night is purer than day; it is better for thinking, loving and dreaming. At night everything is more intense, more true. The echo of words that have been spoken during the day takes on a new and deeper meaning.
author: Elie Wiesel, Dawn

quote: This day I ceased to plead. I was no longer capable of lamentation. On the contrary, I felt very strong. I was the accuser, God the accused.
author: Elie Wiesel, Night
category: elie-wiesel, faith, god, lamentation, night, religion

quote: The peaceful splendour of the night healed again. The moon was now past the meridian and travelling down the west. It was at its full, and very bright, riding through the empty blue sky.
author: H.G. Wells
category: island, island-of-dr-moreau, moon, moonlight, nature, night

quote: The whole of Paris was lit up. The tiny dancing flames had bespangled the sea of darkness from end to end of the horizon, and now, like millions of stars, they burned with a steady light in the serene summer night. There was no breath of wind to make them flicker as they hung there in space. They made the unseen city seem as vast as a firmament, reaching out into infinity.
author: Émile Zola, Une Page d'amour

quote: Now the evening's at its noon, its meridian. The outgoing tide has simmered down, and there's a lull-like the calm in the eye of a hurricane - before the reverse tide starts to set in.The last acts of the three-act plays are now on, and the after-theater eating places are beginning to fill up with early comers; Danny's and Lindy's - yes, and Horn & Hardart too. Everybody has got where they wanted to go - and that was out somewhere. Now everybody will want to get back where they came from - and that's home somewhere. Or as the coffee-grinder radio, always on the beam, put it at about this point: 'New York, New York, it's a helluva town, The Bronx is up, the Battery's down, And the people ride around in a hole in the ground.Now the incoming tide rolls in; the hours abruptly switch back to single digits again, and it's a little like the time you put your watch back on entering a different time zone. Now the buses knock off and the subway expresses turn into locals and the locals space themselves far apart; and as Johnny Carson's face hits millions of screens all at one and the same time, the incoming tide reaches its crest and pounds against the shore. There's a sudden splurge, a slew of taxis arriving at the hotel entrance one by one as regularly as though they were on a conveyor belt, emptying out and then going away again.Then this too dies down, and a deep still sets in. It's an around-the-clock town, but this is the stretch; from now until the garbage-grinding trucks come along and tear the dawn to shreds, it gets as quiet as it's ever going to get.This is the deep of the night, the dregs, the sediment at the bottom of the coffee cup. The blue hours; when guys' nerves get tauter and women's fears get greater. Now guys and girls make love, or kill each other or sometimes both. And as the windows on the 'Late Show' title silhouette light up one by one, the real ones all around go dark. And from now on the silence is broken only by the occasional forlorn hoot of a bogged-down drunk or the gutted-cat squeal of a too sharply swerved axle coming around a turn. Or as Billy Daniels sang it in Golden Boy: While the city sleeps, And the streets are clear, There's a life that's happening here.("New York Blues")
author: Cornell Woolrich, Night and Fear: A Centenary Collection of Stories by Cornell Woolrich
category: city-at-night, evening, midnight, new-york-city, night, the-blue-hour, twilight

quote: Most nightmares are caged in their realm by implausibilities. The sleeper slogs through quicksand in a fun house of frightening nonsense and disjointed mumbo jumbo. But everything’s all better once the bedside lamp is back on, because reality, even when it’s bad, is easily distinguished from night terror. Except for the trying-to-scream dream. That one’s pretty much spot-on.
author: Jamie  Mason

quote: I had gone...to the smoke of cafes and nights when the room whirled and you needed to look at the wall to make it stop, nights in bed, drunk, when you knew that that was all there was, and the strange excitement of waking and not knowing who it was with you, and the world all unreal in the dark and so exciting that you must resume again unknowing and not caring in the night, sure that this was all and all and all and not caring. Suddenly to care very much and to sleep to wake with it sometimes morning and all that had been there gone and everything sharp and hard and clear and sometimes a dispute about the cost. Sometimes still pleasant and fond and warm and breakfast and lunch. Sometimes all niceness gone and glad to get out on the street but always another day starting and then another night. I tried to tell about the night and the difference between the night and the day and how the night was better unless the day was very clean and cold and I could not tell it; as I cannot tell it now. But if you have had it you know.
author: Ernest Hemingway, A Farewell to Arms

quote: Man asks and God replies but we don't understand his replies because they dwell in the depths of our souls and remain there until we die.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: POSTNot a head stands out A finger rises Then it is the voice that one knows A signal a brief note A man leaves Up above a cloud that passes by No one goes in And the night keeps its secret
author: Pierre Reverdy, The Cubist Poets in Paris: An Anthology

quote: It's true though: time moves in its own special way in the middle of the night," the bartender says, loudly striking a book match and lighting a cigarette. "You can't fight it.
author: Haruki Murakami, After Dark

quote: Night is a world lit by itself
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: We should live, my Lesbia, and loveAnd value all the talk of stricterOld men at a single penny.Suns can set and rise again;For us, once our brief light has set,There's one unending night for sleeping.Give me a thousand kisses, then a hundred,Then another thousand, then a second hundred,Then still another thousand, then a hundred;Then, when we've made many thousands,We'll muddle them so as not to knowOr lest some villain overlook usKnowing the total of our kisses.(Translated by Guy Lee)
author: Catullus, The Complete Poems
category: guy-lee, kisses, lesbia, love, night, romance

quote: You know you love him when you can't sleep at night and get up early to talk to him the next morning.
author: Kayla Carson

quote: It's six o'clock; my drink is at the three-quarter mark - three-quarters down not three-quarters up - and the night begins.("New York Blues")
author: Cornell Woolrich, Night and Fear: A Centenary Collection of Stories by Cornell Woolrich

quote: The bleak autumn wind was still blowing, and the solemn, surging moan of it in the wood was dreary and awful to hear through the night silence. Issac felt strangely wakeful. He resolved, as he lay down in bed, to keep the candle alight until he began to grow sleepy; for there was something unendurably depressing in the bare idea of lying awake in the darkness, listening to the dismal, ceaseless moan of the wind in the wood. ("The Dream Woman")
author: Wilkie Collins, Reign of Terror Volume 2: Great Victorian Horror Stories

quote: At the end of the day, when the sun falls a willing prisoner of the night...and humans, males and females alike, become submitted to the mistress of the dark, my mind begins to wander and wonder. Looking upwards at a blank slate of concrete, the psyque expresses freely what my subconscious is afraid to give free rein. And there and then, between the play of reality and dreamland, I find my place. I find myself.
author: Eiry Nieves

quote: A scattering of pinpoint lights shows up in the blackness ahead. A town or village straddling the highway. The indicator on the speedometer begins to lose ground. The man glances in his mirror at the girl, a little anxiously as if this oncoming town were some kind of test to be met.An illuminated road sign flashes by: CAUTION! MAIN STREET AHEAD - SLOW UP The man nods grimly, as if agreeing with that first word. But not in the way it is meant.The lights grow bigger, spread out on either side. Street lights peer out here and there among the trees. The highway suddenly sprouts a plank sidewalk on each side of it. Dark store-windows glide by.With an instinctive gesture, the man dims his lights from blinding platinum to just a pale wash. A lunch-room window drifts by. ("Jane Brown's Body")
author: Cornell Woolrich, The Fantastic Stories of Cornell Woolrich

quote: The moon seemed to veil herself before the bold looks of Satan. The night was cold. All the doors were closed, all the windows darkened. and the streets deserted. From their appearance, one would have imagined that, for a long time past no foot had traversed those silent streets. Everything around us bore a death-like aspect. It seemed as if, when day came, no one would open their doors; that no head, of woman or of child, would look out of those dark, dull windows; that no step would break the silence which fell, like a pall, upon all around. I seemed to be walking in a city which had been buried some ages. In truth, the town seemed to have been depopulated, and the cemetery to have grown full.Still we went forward, without hearing a murmur, or meeting even with a shadow. The street stretched for a long way across this fearful city of silence and repose. At last we reached my house.'You remember it?' said the fiend.'Yes,' replied I, sullenly, 'let us enter.' 'First,' said he, 'we must open the door. It is I, by the way, who invented the science of opening doors without breaking them in. In fact, I have a second key to all doors and gates - with one exception - that of Paradise!
author: James Hain Friswell
category: deserted, devil, door, doors, key, keys, late, lock, locks, lonely, night, satan, town

quote: A raging, glowering full moon had come up, was peering down over the side of the sky well above the patio.That was the last thing she saw as she leaned for a moment, inert with fatigue, against the doorway of the room in which her child lay. Then she dragged herself in to topple headlong upon the bed and, already fast asleep, to circle her child with one protective arm, moving as if of its own instinct.Not the meek, the pallid, gentle moon of home. This was the savage moon that had shone down on Montezuma and Cuauhtemoc, and came back looking for them now. The primitive moon that had once looked down on terraced heathen cities and human sacrifices. The moon of Anahuac. ("The Moon Of Montezuma")
author: Cornell Woolrich, The Fantastic Stories of Cornell Woolrich

quote: After that there was silence for a while, only the sound of the shovel biting into the earth and the hissing splatter of the loose dirt.They stood him up, his back to the well.In the dark, desperate sky, just above the scalloped line the treetops made, three stars formed a pleading little constellation. No one looked at them, no one cared. This was the time for death, not the time for mercy. ("The Number's Up")
author: Cornell Woolrich

quote: It had grown darker now; it was full night already, with the swiftness of the mountainous latitudes. The square of sky over the patio was soft and dark as indigo velour, with magnificent stars like many-legged silver spiders festooned on its underside. Below them the white roses gleamed phosphorescently in the starlight, with a magnesium-like glow. There was a tiny splash from the depths of the well as a pebble or grain of dislodged earth fell in. ("The Moon Of Montezuma")
author: Cornell Woolrich, The Fantastic Stories of Cornell Woolrich

quote: Now the moon of the Aztecs is at the zenith, and all the world lies still. Full and white, the white of bones, the white of a skull; blistering the center of the sky well with its throbbing, not touching it on any side. Now the patio is a piebald place of black and white, burning in the downward-teeming light. Not a leaf moves, not a petal falls, in this fierce amalgam. ("The Moon Of Montezuma")
author: Cornell Woolrich, The Fantastic Stories of Cornell Woolrich

quote: Three o'clock in the morning.The highway is empty, under a malignant moon. The oil drippings make the roadway gleam like a blue-satin ribbon. The night is still but for a humming noise coming up somewhere behind a rise of ground.Two other, fiercer, whiter moons, set close together, suddenly top the rise, shoot a fan of blinding platinum far down ahead of them. Headlights. The humming burgeons into a roar. The touring car is going so fast it sways from side to side. The road is straight. The way is long. The night is short. (Jane Brown's Body")
author: Cornell Woolrich, The Fantastic Stories of Cornell Woolrich

quote: The worst things always happen at night, and oftener than one would think on stormy nights. ("The Compensation House")
author: Charles Collins

quote: Night sometimes lends such tragic assistance to catastrophe.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: I can see lights in the distance trembling in the dark cloak of nightCandles and lanterns are dancing, dancing a waltz on All Souls Night.
author: Loreena McKennitt

quote: War is like night, she said. It covers everything.
author: Elie Wiesel, Dawn

quote: To go to bed at night in Madrid marks you as a little queer. For a long time your friends will be a little uncomfortable about it. Nobody goes to bed in Madrid until they have killed the night. Appointments with a friend are habitually made for after midnight at the cafe.
author: Ernest Hemingway, Death in the Afternoon

quote: They lay on their heathery beds and listened to all the sounds of the night. They heard the little grunt of a hedgehog going by. They saw the flicker of bats overhead. They smelt the drifting scent of honeysuckle, and the delicious smell of wild thyme crushed under their bodies. A reed-warbler sang a beautiful little song in the reeds below, and then another answered.
author: Enid Blyton, The Secret Island
category: bats, heather, honeysuckle, nature, night, reeds, scents, sounds, thyme

quote: I push against the tree and run away, stumbling, the unreal night playing with me, gravity pulling from below, behind, above, making me fall. And I run through a world that is rotating, conscious of the earth's spin, of our planet twirling as it careens through nothingness, of the stars spiraling above, of the uncertainty of everything, even ground, even sky. Mumtaz never calls out, although a thousand and one voices scream in my mind, sing, whisper, taunt me with madness.
author: Mohsin Hamid, Moth Smoke
category: gravity, madness, night, nothingness, uncertainty, unreal

quote: Anyone and anything can survive the daylight. It's night that's the hardest to live.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker

quote: ... going out late at night and laying in the dewy field and reading a Kurt Vonnegut book by moonlight.
author: John Green, Looking for Alaska

quote: And at night the river flows, it bears pale stars on the holy water, some sink like veils, some show like fish, the great moon that once was rose now high like a blazing milk flails its white reflection vertical and deep in the dark surgey mass wall river's grinding bed push. As in a sad dream, under the streetlamp, by pocky unpaved holes in dirt, the father James Cassidy comes home with lunchpail and lantern, limping, redfaced, and turns in for supper and sleep.Now a door slams. The kids have rushed out for the last play, the mothers are planning and slamming in kitchens, you can hear it out in swish leaf orchards, on popcorn swings, in the million-foliaged sweet wafted night of sighs, songs, shushes. A thousand things up and down the street, deep, lovely, dangerous, aureating, breathing, throbbing like stars; a whistle, a faint yell; the flow of Lowell over rooftops beyond; the bark on the river, the wild goose of the night yakking, ducking in the sand and sparkle; the ululating lap and purl and lovely mystery on the shore, dark, always dark the river's cunning unseen lips, murmuring kisses, eating night, stealing sand, sneaky.'Mag-gie!' the kids are calling under the railroad bridge where they've been swimming. The freight train still rumbles over a hundred cars long, the engine threw the flare on little white bathers, little Picasso horses of the night as dense and tragic in the gloom comes my soul looking for what was there that disappeared and left, lost, down a path--the gloom of love. Maggie, the girl I loved.
author: Jack Kerouac, Maggie Cassidy

quote: The sun had burned through and the day had gone from dull to dazzling, yet in the west blask-satin thunderheads continued to stack up. It was as if night has burst a blood-vessel in the sky over there.
author: Stephen King, Bag of Bones

quote: It was a good apple too. A good apple, picked by a madman on a full moon night.
author: Steven Herrick, A Place Like This

quote: Mystique saturates, gluts the air,Adventure’s even more than rare,Excitement’s everywhere to share,And Novelty’s beyond compare.
author: Mariecor Ruediger, HOT STUFF:  Celebrating Summer's Simmer and Sizzle

quote: You don't look very happy."Tally tried to smile. David had shared his biggest secret with her; she should tell him hers. But she wasn't brave enough to say the words. "It's been a long night. That's all."He smiled back. "Don't worry, it won't last forever.
author: Scott Westerfeld

quote: I hope I never figure out who broke your heart and if I do, if I do. I'd spend all night losing sleep. I'd spend the night and I'd lose my mind. Well I'd spend the night and I'd lose my mind.
author: Sara Quin
category: borken-heart, if-it-was-you, living-room, lose-my-mind, night, sara-quin, tegan-and-sara, tegan-quin

quote: A night of exhilaration, of boredom and terror, in which the merest of sounds took on other forms - grew large in the expanse of darkness. After several hours the sheep gradually stopped calling to each other from accross the river banks, and a brittle quiet descended. I desperately wanted to walk down to the water's edge. To see the black river in the moonlight. But a mixture of reason and fear kept me locked along the safe paths high above.
author: Richard Skelton
category: affraid, aloneness, landings, night, poetry, river

quote: Friendship is like a stubborn child who is playing hide and seek with your life. You have to find him at the darkest places of your heart in difficult times. And when you find the child
author: his smile will light up the darkness of your life.
category: Sandeep Sharma, Let The Game Begin

quote: I swear I've good morals. It's just that bad ones befriend me. I'm a friendly person, you know. But I will talk to them. Believe you me.
author: Fakeer Ishavardas
category: crazy-quotes, friendship-quotes, funny-humor, funny-quotes, goodness-quotes, humour-life, jokes-and-whatever, laughter-is-the-best-medicine, lifestyle-quotes, nutty-as-a-fruitcake

quote: One who knows the law of connectivity is a universal friend
author: Rajasaraswathii, A Diary to win

quote: I know they were mean to me and to you, but helping them now is the right thing to do.
author: Lauren Isabelle Pierre, Tip & Lulu: A tale of two friends
category: childrens-book-quotes, childrens-books, compassion-quotes, empathy-for-others, friendship-quotes, kindness-quotes, picture-books-for-kids

quote: Friends could be more influential than spouses. Hence selection should be based on attitude not apparel, on outcome not outlook, on personal beliefs not parental background.
author: Haruna Idowu

quote: It is better to be with animalandia friends, rather than those perfectly imperfect persons.
author: Jammi Avila

quote: Friends will change saddest moments into happiest moments in life
author: Rehaman M

quote: Every person who walks into your life unlocks and unravels hidden dimensions within YOU, which even you're unaware of, what's more fascinating is that only he holds the key to that facet of YOU and the day he leaves you, with him the key is lost forever. This is the most mysterious paradigm in the journey called LIFE!
author: Ramana Pemmaraju

quote: Friendship is like a flower. It needs daily love and care to blossom. If you forget to give it water, the flower dies. It’s as simple as that! Teddy
author: Lily Amis, Teddy & Lily -  True Friendship is unconditional Loyalty

quote: Be careful who you trust and tell your problems to. Not everyone who smiles at you is your friend.
author: Basheer Amiri

quote: A true friend is anyone who is always unleashing greatness in you not destruction..Choose wisely
author: Mlungisi Simelane

quote: In the end, what will hurt us the most is not the words of our enemies but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: Your close friends are essentially important in making you a person of high personal worth and success.
author: Seema Brain Openers

quote: Not all the friends who say they are yours are friends indeed
author: Brighton Mabuya

quote: Spend sunny afternoons writing. Take weekends in the country. Dream. Drink good wine, eat fabulous cheese and great bread. Make the kind of love that destroys the bed.
author: Rachel Hauck, The Writing Desk

quote: A friend won't always be there, at times you are on your own, but alone you still may find light.
author: K.R. Royal

quote: Like most people on the planet I have experienced moments when a friend’s, or just a stranger’s, warm cheering up was like a gulp of oxygen essential for survival.
author: Sahara Sanders

quote: Friendship is not a national affair
author: It goes beyond borders.

quote: Friendship lasts for four seasons and more.
author: Sir Kristian Goldmund Aumann

quote: Each new frienship begins with the first word.
author: GE Paulus

quote: True friendships are life-saving bridges over troubled waters.
author: Sir Kristian Goldmund Aumann

quote: Many People Say I'm Your Friend without knowing the Meaning of a Friendship
author: Jan Jansen Easy Branches

quote: I think online friends often know you the best.
author: Jacquelyn Middleton, London Belongs to Me

quote: We are just good friends. This sentence is enough to destroy at least one person.
author: Sarvesh Jain, The Awakening Wisdom of Life: Probably the best Quotation Book in the world

quote: We are all an unforgettable artwork and a story yet to be told.
author: Steven Cuoco

quote: The value of friendship is based on a solid underline friendship.
author: Abdulazeez Henry Musa

quote: Friendship is not just about having fun, it’s about supporting each other in time of weakness.
author: Abdulazeez Henry Musa

quote: Some people in our life are like a lighthouse,They guide us to safety as we navigate the coast
author: Mohammed Sekouty

quote: Maybe we're on the wrong side of some metaphorical bridge where the grass is crusty and not grass at all, but sharp little spines of glass. I dunno, Moritz.But the one little speck of green that I get is your letters, so please never stop writing me.You got that?Never stop.Because you'll never meet me and it's the closest we can get.
author: Leah Thomas, Because You'll Never Meet Me

quote: Do not keep on with a mockery of friendship after the substance is gone - but part, while you can part friends. Bury the carcass of friendship: it is not worth embalming.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Friendship is as great as a True FriendAnd A True Friend is as great as True Friendship. Quote by Sharvani Akula
author: Sharvani Akula

quote: As relationships wane, let the love remain.
author: Eileen Anglin

quote: Sometimes there is that one person who "gets" you,whom you can talk to about anything,you can be yourself around them,you have that connection,be in the same room without saying anything but the silence is the sweetest sound you ever heard lol...To call each other friends sounds too ordinary and detached,to call each other boyfriend and girlfriend sounds rehearsed and whats expected...its something in between,it has no name...Its only felt
author: Dru Edmund Kucherera

quote: People who are not on Facebook are face to face.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: It is better to have just one friend that adds value to your life than having a million friends that add no value to your life.
author: Abdulazeez Henry Musa

quote: It's more dangerous to have a friend then it is to have an enemy.
author: James Jean-Pierre, Unlocking Of Secrets

quote: Your best day can always become a great day. Your attitude solely depends on this.
author: Steven Cuoco
category: best-quote-ever, brainy-quotes, brainy-words, friendship-quotes, inspirational-quotes, international-authors, quote-of-the-day, quotes-to-live-by

quote: Sometimes we are fortunate enough to pick our own extended family. We call them as our friends.
author: Premchand Shetty

quote: Those who are day and night with us from the childhoodWhose emotions are with exaltation of youthThey are with us in every difficult journey of lifeThey are our True FriendsWith us in every path of life..!!!
author: Shubhm Singh

quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship and I have received it.
author: Hubert  H. Humphrey

quote: A nice warm shower, a cup of tea, and a caring ear may be all you need to warm your heart.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: The Doctor: You betrayed me. You betrayed my trust, you betrayed our friendship, you betrayed everything I ever stood for. You let me down!Clara: Then why are you helping me?The Doctor: Why? Do you think I care for you so little that betraying me would make a difference?
author: Steven Moffat

quote: Togetherness is finite. There is nothing like forever. Time ends. At different times for different people. So we should always be thankful for the time that we spent together.
author: Aditi Bose, My Dream Man

quote: We all want good friends - kind, respected, nice. The kind of people you want to introduce to your parents, other friends, pastor. But never underestimate the value of immoral friends - the ones that create the most precious memories you never will tell anyone else!
author: Jury Nel

quote: A true friend let’s you know that the door is always open, even when it’s closed.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: Our friendship has survived betrayals and our ambitions. Even death is afraid to come between us. Welcome back to my life." ~ Fidelis O Mkparu, author of 'Love's Affliction' ‪#‎authors‬, ‪#‎friendship‬
author: Fidelis O. Mkparu

quote: I haven't seen much but the one thing life has taught me so far is at least one out of every ten friend will not be jealous of your success.
author: Nikhil Kushwaha, Heart of Bullets

quote: An evil person will have evil friends
author: a righteous person will have righteous friends.The company you keep is hidden treasure or masked demise.

quote: Pick your friends like you pick your battles
author: wisely.

quote: A true friend lets you know that the door is always open, even when it’s closed.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: It is not the amount of friends that is important, but the amount of integrity, sincerity, and love in your friends
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: It seems to me, that no matter what we do, no matter what choices we make, there isn’t a happy ending waiting for us at the end of the long road.”“But that doesn’t mean we give up. It doesn’t mean we stop fighting.
author: Danielle L. Jensen, Hidden Huntress

quote: As we change, we sometimes outgrow our friendships. And, since we cannot change this fact, it is best to simply accept it for what it is in order to appreciate the power that the friend had in your life when he or she was a part of it.
author: Lindsay Detwiler, Voice of Innocence

quote: The company you keep determines how others view you. Identify with mediocrity and you will be labeled sub par. Collaborate with questionable people and your reputation becomes suspect. Guilt by association can end a career, hurt your business and cost you friends. Choose alliances wisely or you may be condemned for someone else's sins.
author: Carlos Wallace, Life Is Not Complicated-You Are: Turning Your Biggest Disappointments Into Your Greatest Blessings

quote: The principle component in any genuine friendship is caring, not competition.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: The principle component in any genuine friendship is compassion, not competition.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: True & Honest friend can act as a best armour for us in the world
author: Prabakaran

quote: The principal component in any genuine friendship is caring, not competition.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: Friendship is like flowers
author: beautiful but delicate.

quote: We had first met in a class on digital imaging
author: together we made an amusing monster.
category: Ruth Skilbeck, Australian Fugue: The Antipode Room

quote: ...having you as a friend wasn’t second prize. It wasn’t something to chafe against. It was an honor.
author: Courtney Milan, The Countess Conspiracy

quote: Every Friendship in my life is as a Gift and have more value then every Pearl in this World, money is for to use, but a human in a Friendship is a treasure to take care and to be Proud, many go for money and never meet the value of life.
author: Jan Jansen

quote: Friendship isn't measured in days, months or years, it's measured in the way someone makes you feel.
author: Alexa Land, Against the Wall

quote: Their friendship is like a tapestry in a drawer. Today is the iron passing over the cloth, smoothing out the wrinkles, bring out the pattern that makes it unique and beautiful.
author: Nancy Thayer, Nantucket Sisters

quote: Books keep and reciprocate our secrets, dreams, regrets, and hopes better than any friend in the world.
author: Drea Damara, The Weeping Books Of Blinney Lane
category: books, dreams, friendship-quotes, hopes, quotes-on-books, regrets, regrets-heartache, weeping-books

quote: A true friend reminds you why you should believe in yourself when you’ve forgotten.
author: Charles F. Glassman

quote: Your path is not my path. Should we meet at the crossroads and ye be a friend, tarry a while, drink some wine and let us laugh for a while. If ye be foe, continue on your merry way and may our paths never cross again.
author: Virginia Alison

quote: At End of my College Life I Must have to say: College Friends are One of Best Friends we ever had in Our Life
author: saud maqood shah

quote: In life we all should learn to forgive but never forget. Best way to learn from our mistakes.
author: Jonathan Anthony Burkett
category: family-drama, friendship-quotes, friendship-true-and-loyal, jonathan-anthony-burkett, lessons-in-life, lessons-learned, life-quotes, love-quotes, mistakes-we-make, people-quote, understanding-oneself-and-others

quote: A true friend reminds you why you should believe in yourself when you have forgotten.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: You are truly home only when you find your tribe
author: Srividya Srinivasan

quote: Friendship is earned by those who accepted each other for what they are and for what they have. Trust and respect flows in each other to make it lasting.
author: John

quote: A friend who will never fail is the one who will stand by you regardless of the situation, time or location.
author: Ellen J. Barrier, How to Trust God When All Other Resources Have Failed

quote: A friend who will never fail is the one who will stand by you regardless of the situation,time or location.
author: Ellen J. Barrier, How to Trust God When All Other Resources Have Failed

quote: When choosing friends, I seek quality, not quantity.
author: Charles F. Glassman, Brain Drain   The Breakthrough That Will Change Your Life

quote: A friend is a companion for the journey,never a means to our own.What we take we take together,the joy we reap, we have sown.
author: Tom Althouse, The Frowny Face Cow

quote: We all have that one friend that walks into your home like its their home
author: Thabang Gideon Magaola

quote: I’ll be your friend until you find a better one.
author: Carla H. Krueger, Sleeping with the Sun

quote: Friendship improves happiness, abates misery by doubling our joy and dividing our grief.
author: John

quote: If you choose to engage in one night stands, make sure you have a good reason and peer pressure is NOT one.
author: Shahla Khan, Friends With Benefits: Rethinking Friendship, Dating & Violence
category: friendship-quotes, hook-up, hook-up-culture, hooking-up, one-night-stands, peer-pressure

quote: Friendship Is just Like A Perennial River Which Flows Forever It May Change Its Path But it Will Never Dry Up Be proud to be my friend
author: Lovely afg

quote: More or less we are all Selfish. When it's come to Friendship, I do think that fish cant jump onto the ship!
author: Shah Moazzem

quote: The true friend no one can try to broke them because you are truthful to each other.
author: Jonnaville

quote: True friendship is the best gift in life.
author: Kristian Goldmund Aumann

quote: YOU CAN'T EXPECT A FULL TIME RELATIONSHIP FROM A PART TIME FRIEND.
author: JAZZIMYN RUSSELL

quote: Friendship is that essence which have all flavor in it, when it is lost the taste of life becomes tasteless.
author: Debolina

quote: a good friendship euchres the universe.
author: Michael Hogan

quote: Well, everyone has a friend who holds a very special place in his life. Talking about men…a friend whom you love unconditionally and selflessly.....a friend who knows every secret of your life and who is always the first person whom you want to call when you are in some mess…a friend who tells you exactly what you want to hear. Ena was such a friend to me. My best friend – if that defines the zenith of good friendship. I would rather say, there is no definition of friendship that we shared with each other, the more I explain it, the more complicated it becomes to recite the aspects of our relationship.She was that closer a friend to me, who knew all the nitty-gritties of my life…from every girl who ever came into my life, to passwords of my email accounts or public profiles. Absolutely everything! She was the only girl on earth I trusted blindly and cared for, truly and unconditionally. She was the only girl who could actually make me dance to her beats. We shared that deeper relationship with each other.
author: Shivam Singh, Best Friends
category: best-friends, friendship, friendship-and-love, friendship-friends, friendship-lost, friendship-quote, friendship-quotes, friendship-true-and-loyal, friendships

quote: When you date someone, you have the markers along the way, right: You kiss, you have The Talk, you say the Three Little Words, you sit on a swing set and break up. You can plot the points on a graph. And you check up with each other along the way: Can I do this? If I say this, will you say it back?"But with friendship, there's nothing like that. Being in a relationship, that's something you choose. Being friends, that's just something you are.
author: John Green

quote: True friends are like our favorite books on a shelf in our home that we look at everyday and continue to read over and over till we learn all we can about them. We never get rid of them, we just keep them to share and cherish our whole life. Some we share with many people but there are those that become our exclusive favorites that we keep in a small group, separated from all the others to learn from and enjoy forever ! Original quote form Doug Prentice
author: Doug Prentice

quote: Our friendship is like a flowerthat seed is planted deep and realBlooms with sunshine and showerand will never wither if gives great care.
author: Kaushal S. Kiroula

quote: Flowers were blooming, withered soon.. Rains kept falling, wasn't forever.. Dogs were barking, just for sometime.. Sun, moon & stars were invisible at times, but they kept watching you.. Let them shine for you, before it’s too late..
author: Heshan Udunuwara

quote: Oh, you will, some day, just as I’ll hurt you too. That makes part of thiswhole thing called being human, but to excel it and sincerely forgive the otherfaults… that is what makes a real friendship, what strengthens it.
author: Léia Kiuski, Revelations

quote: Jill!” I called to her through our connecting bathroom as I pulled on some jeans. “You realize I’ve been more than twenty-four hours without a shower, right?” “Oh, who cares,” she grumbled. “You look fine. Just put on some deodorant and a bra. I mean, aren’t we just going to be getting sweaty lugging your stuff down from storage anyway?
author: J.M.  Richards, Tall, Dark Streak of Lightning
category: best-friends, friendship, friendship-quotes, girltalk, j-m-richards, kickass-girls, tall-dark-streak-of-lightning, tdsol, who-cares

quote: There is no limit of what you can or don't do! as the word itself gives you the strength to survive called friendship..
author: Sriram

quote: I always took Brielle for granted, putting Mckayla first. Little did I know that my first friend in the whole world would be the only true friend that I have now.
author: Nicole Gulla, The Lure of the Moon

quote: FRIENDSHIP - A Journey of different souls through the path of LOVE
author: Sreejith Ganesan

quote: Lead from the back — and let others believe they are in front.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Alexander, Caesar, Charlemagne, and I have founded empires. But on what did we rest the creations of our genius? Upon force. Jesus Christ founded his empire upon love; and at this hour millions of men would die for him.
author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quote: Lead from the front — but don t leave your base behind.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: Sign of a true leader - shares the knowledge with smile...
author: Adil Adam Memon

quote: If we need the protection of men, let us first ask it from God. If we prevail with Him, the power of the most mighty and of the most wicked must minister to our relief.
author: Alexander Carson

quote: Sign of a leader - Believe in others.....
author: Adil Adam Memon

quote: In a pre-scientific society the best the common man can do is pin his faith on a leader and give him his support, trusting in his benevolence against the misuse of the delegated power and in his wisdom to govern justly and make war successfully.
author: B.F. Skinner, Walden Two

quote: Leaders are not just personalities or identities we follow, they are ideas, everything belongs to them gives you a feel which forces you to rethink about your own-self (Life) and tracks (Purpose of life) you are walking on, even their remembrance gives you an energy which is powerful enough to shape your reality, even the realities of those who hate them.
author: Mohsin Ali Shaukat

quote: Leaders are not just personalities or identities you follow, they are ideas, everything belongs to them gives you a feel which forces you to rethink about your own-self (Life) and tracks (Purpose of life) you are walking on, even their remembrance gives you an energy which is powerful enough that it can shape your reality, even the realities of those who hate them.
author: Mohsin Ali Shaukat

quote: Managers and leaders cause most of the organizational confusion and frustration by not doing their jobs — their real jobs.
author: Liz Weber, Something Needs to Change Around Here

quote: The success of any country relies on the commitment of its leaders to serve others.
author: Gift Gugu Mona

quote: Exceptional leaders are fearless in setting expectations in clear language.
author: Alan Willett

quote: Leaders are builders. They build bridges to unite, not walls to divide.
author: Farshad Asl

quote: Our community deserves leaders who should know what debates and arguments are better conducted out of the public eye, instead of dumping their baskets of dirty laundry all over the internet. Our community deserves leaders who do not put political expedience or convenience before their commitments to those they supposedly represent. Our community deserves leaders who do not make about-turns on issues such as freedom of speech and accountability to the community they serve when it becomes too embarrassing for them, or too uncomfortable. Our community deserves leaders who can and want to work together, not fling their handbags at each other, hissing like drama queens.
author: Christina Engela
category: about-turns, accountability, arguments, baskets, commitments, community, conducted, convenience, debates, deserves, dirty-laundry, drama-queens, dumping, embarrassing, fling, freedom-of-speech, handbags, hissing, internet, issues, leaders, political-expedience, public-eye, represent, supposedly, uncomfortable, work-together

quote: Organisations are innovating quicker than ever. Your members need to excel from being a team player to a team builder.
author: Janna Cachola
category: high-performance-organisations, leaders, leadership-characteristics, team, team-builder, team-spirit, teamwork

quote: Mangers consolidate the present. Leaders create the future.
author: Dr. Asoka Jinadasa

quote: True Mentors, don't make their mentees a clone of themselves
author: Bernard Kelvin Clive
category: leaders, leadership-development, leadership-quotes, mentee, mentoring, mentorship-quote

quote: To need to dominate others is to need others. The commander is dependent.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Great business leaders of our time stand above the crowd not because of what they do, but what they don’t do.
author: Shawn Casemore, Operational Empowerment: Collaborate, Innovate, and Engage to Beat the Competition

quote: ... When Princes devote themselves rather to pleasure than to arms, they lose their dominions.
author: Niccolò Machiavelli, The Prince

quote: Perseverance is the steady pathway toward prevailing.
author: Tom Althouse, The Frowny Face Cow

quote: No man is a complete ruler or dictator. He is only the mouthpiece for the wishes of his followers. As long as he expresses those wishes, he leads them.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: ... War is the sole art looked for in one who rules...
author: Niccolò Machiavelli, The Prince

quote: Real leaders don't rule over territories but over heart's of the people.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: A nation can be mighty, when the citizens put away their political differences, work together for a common vision, a common goal and a common good.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: africa, building-people-up, citizens, common-goal, faith, ghana, hard-work, hope, inspirational, leaders, nation, patriotism, politics, restoration, working-together

quote: …golf was no longer the most interesting sport to the corporate czars because they found playing with natural balls much more satisfying.
author: Pawan Mishra, Coinman: An Untold Conspiracy
category: balls, corporate, corporate-czars, executive, golf, leaders, managers, satisfaction, workplace

quote: We live in a country where our young ladies who have recently attained the age of puberty cannot afford sanitary pads, but our men and women in public offices have ipads which they do not even know how to use.
author: Patrick L.O. Lumumba
category: africa, african-leaders, african-leadership, girl-power, harmon-okinyo, ipad, ipad-vs-everything, leaders, patrick-loch-otieno-lumumba, patrick-lumumba, patrick-lumumba-kenya, women-s-rights

quote: Great leaders create great cultures regardless of the dominant culture in the organization.
author: Bob   Anderson, Mastering Leadership: An Integrated Framework for Breakthrough Performance and Extraordinary Business Results

quote: Leaders set the context and create the conditions in which individuals and organizations thrive.
author: Bob   Anderson, Mastering Leadership: An Integrated Framework for Breakthrough Performance and Extraordinary Business Results
category: conditions, context, individuals, leaders, leadership-characteristics, organizations, thrive

quote: When we limit ourselves by being the person we “should” be, we limit our aliveness. We may achieve success but not fulfillment because we are not living out all the important truths about ourselves, truths we need to slow down to excavate.
author: Henna Inam, Wired for Authenticity: Seven Practices to Inspire, Adapt, & Lead
category: aliveness, authentic-leadership, authentic-self, fulfillment, leaders, truths

quote: Most people do not want to follow a leader, they want to command the leading of a servant.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau
category: command, fools, idiocy, leaders, servitude, wicked-devils

quote: Leaders in the body of Christ must be humble and broken from the Lord’s hand to be truly useful in His kingdom.
author: Greg  Gordon

quote: Before we ask where the leaders are, we should look in a mirror and ask the person we see “Why are you not leading”?
author: Carlos Wallace

quote: Rest and comfort are two different things. Rest is a planned temporary time to refresh and refocus the leader. Comfort is when you settle into unproductive routines and accept satisfactory or unsatisfactory results.
author: Gary Rohrmayer
category: comfort, comfortable, leaders, leadership, leadership-characteristics, rest, results, results-coach, results-quote, routine

quote: Self-reliance is an America virtue but not a biblical value. Solomon wrote, "The way of fools seems right to them, but the wise listen to advice." (Proverbs 12:15) The word 'listen' carries with it the meaning of seeking out as well as receiving advice. A lot of pain can be prevented if leaders would just check in with their coach before a making a big decision.
author: Gary Rohrmayer
category: coachable, coaching, coaching-best-practices, coaching-executive, coaching-quotes, decisions, leaders, leadership-characteristics, leadership-development, listening-to-others, proverbs

quote: Leaders should not stand in front of people. They should stand behind the people.
author: Sadghuru

quote: Missional leaders are comfortable in the own skin.
author: Gary Rohrmayer, Next Steps For Leading a Missional Church
category: leaders, leadership, leadership-characteristics, mission, missional, missionaries, missionary, missionary-work, pastor, pastoral-ministry, pastors

quote: Nobody is rewarded for occupying a position, but for becoming effective in the position occupied. If you occupy a position, you must have the weight of influence in order to matter!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Watchwords
category: effective, impact, influence, lead, lead-people, leader, leaders, leadership, make-a-difference, myles-munroe, occupy, position, positions, post, reward, rewards, weight

quote: Somebody had said how only 15 paisa of the one rupee sent from the Centre reached the intended beneficiaries. The job of a leader isn't just to diagnose the disease but to treat it
author: Narendra Modi

quote: Never follow a follower who is following someone who has fallen. It's why the whole world is falling apart.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: If you don’t know what your barriers are, it’s impossible to figure out how to tear them down.
author: John    Manning, The Disciplined Leader: Keeping the Focus on What Really Matters

quote: Successful leaders know how to line up support for their initiatives and create the right environment for change and innovation.
author: Bonnie Marcus, The Politics of Promotion: How High-Achieving Women Get Ahead and Stay Ahead
category: environment, initiatives, innovation, leaders, leadership, women, workplace

quote: Don’t let your principles sit idle on a plaque. Bring them to life.
author: Cheryl A. Bachelder, Dare to Serve: How to Drive Superior Results by Serving Others

quote: Demonstrating integrity is indispensable for leaders.
author: Scott K. Edinger, The Hidden Leader: Discover and Develop Greatness Within Your Company

quote: Know the strength of the followers and tap into their energy. Get others involved. Trust them to do their best. Finally, don't forget to praise the workers.
author: Teresa Hampton, Leading Ladies: Willing Hearts, Willing Hands

quote: But as much as we like the familiar, as leaders we must be willing to learn, and learning many times requires stretching, growing, and becoming a bit uncomfortable in the process.
author: Teresa Hampton, Leading Ladies: Willing Hearts, Willing Hands

quote: Divide and rule, the politician cries;Unite and lead, is watchword of the wise.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Gedichte
category: divide-and-conquer, lead, leaders, people, politicians, politics, sectarianism, unite, wise

quote: Thought leadership is when a leader's thoughts are being used by leaders to lead others.
author: Onyi Anyado
category: leaders, leadership, leadership-characteristics, leadership-development, thought-leader, thought-leaders

quote: It is interesting to note that an overwhelming majority of citizens in the world's three largest democracies have different religions: India (81 percent Hindu), the United States (76 percent Christian), and Indonesia (87 percent Muslim). Two of them have elected women as leaders of their government.
author: Jimmy Carter, A Call to Action: Women, Religion, Violence, and Power

quote: Intellectuals are rarely successful as leaders. They are so trapped in their ideals that they cannot venture out in the real world to win and lead.
author: Awdhesh Singh, The Secret Red Book of Leadership

quote: Leaders are usually a reflection of the people they lead. How can a leader be moral if his people are immoral?
author: Awdhesh Singh, The Secret Red Book of Leadership

quote: It is never easy for any leader to choose between differentiation and equality. You are condemned either way. When you treat everyone equally, you are considered just by majority as equality benefits below average people and they seem to always be in majority. At the same time, you are also condemned because you can’t produce results with people having a crab mentality. However, if you choose to reward the excellence and punish the non-performer, you achieve the desired results but get condemned for being unfair, unjust, cruel and Darwinian.
author: Awdhesh Singh

quote: Effective leaders allow God to shape them into the kind of people they need to be for each situation they encounter.
author: Jim George, A Leader After God's Own Heart: 15 Ways to Lead with Strength
category: chirstian, god, heart, jim-george, leaders, leadership, situation

quote: All great leaders are known to have faith. They first develop faith in themselves, which means they connect their body, mind and intellect with their soul. They also connect their soul with the Universal Soul where all souls of the world are connected with each other. Leadership is thus a spiritual quality that comes from faith and trust.
author: Awdhesh Singh, Practising Spiritual Intelligence: For Innovation, Leadership and Happiness

quote: If you wish to succeed as a leader, you should be capable of transforming the souls of people, which control their intellect, mind and body. A good leader transforms the souls of the people, which then become like his own soul...Once the nature of the followers is changed, they ‘willingly’ follow the path of their leader A leader transforms ordinary men into exceptionally powerful people just like a strong magnet transforms an ordinary piece of iron into a powerful magnet.
author: Awdhesh Singh

quote: The most interesting aspect of leadership is that it cannot be predicted. All great leaders had been quite ordinary in their early years. It was only when they became leaders that people started recognising them as leaders.It is difficult to identify specific qualities that make a leader. However, when leaders emerge, people are inclined to point out their leadership qualities. Yet, when other people imbibe the same qualities and try to imitate the actions of their leaders, they may fail.
author: Awdhesh Singh, Practising Spiritual Intelligence: For Innovation, Leadership and Happiness

quote: Academically brilliant persons usually make excellent managers and bureaucrats as they can efficiently implement the vision of the government or world leaders by following the prescribed methods. However, they may prove to be poor leaders, for they may not have taken the pain to understand the world on their own, and hence, cannot contribute any new thought or line of action to tackle new problems.
author: Awdhesh Singh, Practising Spiritual Intelligence: For Innovation, Leadership and Happiness

quote: Those who are blindly led, blindly follow.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau

quote: A leader is one who chooses the interest of his followers over his personal ignominy. He can beg, steal and even snatch for the followers. He suffers individual loss for the sake of the gain of his followers. That makes him a leader whom people follow because they themselves do not have the courage to do so. People do not mind if someone else does all the dirty jobs for them while they can enjoy the fruits without getting their own hands dirty.
author: Awdhesh Singh, The Secret Red Book of Leadership

quote: We praise our leaders when they act against our adversaries. But when our own interest is threatened, we begin to dislike the same leaders, irrespective of the sincerity of their intentions. An effective leader is bound to create enemies.
author: Awdhesh Singh, The Secret Red Book of Leadership

quote: Hatred is the emotional price leaders must pay for getting love and honour.
author: Awdhesh Singh, The Secret Red Book of Leadership

quote: Effective leaders have the ability to serve and appreciate others while at the same time enabling them to achieve greatness.
author: -Shandel Slaten

quote: Impersonators, with time give up hope, but great leaders imitate with discretion.
author: S. E. Entsua-Mensah

quote: Like creating a masterpiece, quitting is an art: you have to decide what to keep within the frame and what to keep out.
author: Richie Norton
category: art, creating, decide, decision, frame, give-up, giving-up, keep, leaders, leadership, masterpiece, organization, quit, quitter, quitters, quitting

quote: Leaders should always be the initiators of reconciliation.
author: Adam LiVecchi

quote: A confident leader is like a duck. Above the water, he is calm and poised while below the water, he is driven by a flurry of focused activity.
author: Todd Stocker
category: activity, inspiration, leaders, leadership, motivational-quotes, movement

quote: Added pressure and responsibility should not change one's leadership style, it should merely expose that which already exists.
author: Mark W. Boyer
category: inspirational-quotes, leaders, leadership, leadership-development, mark-boyer, wisdom

quote: People with power do not regulate their behavior as much. They become egocentric and preoccupied with their own self-interest, which eclipses their awareness of the interests of others.
author: Dean M. Schroeder, The Idea-Driven Organization: Unlocking the Power in Bottom-Up Ideas

quote: Leadership defined: An equal and dual commitment to both results and relationships without compromising one for the other.
author: Al Ritter

quote: If prophets are real, they are not leaders but followers.
author: M.F. Moonzajer

quote: Politicians obfuscate. It gets them re-elected. If no-one can understand what is going on, then the perception is that we need someone to guide us through the fog. Many people want to be led. A few people even think that they need to be led.
author: Sieg Pedde

quote: Effective leaders make it easy for people around them to tell the truth, to be candid and open.
author: Al Ritter

quote: The most dangerous leadership myth is that leaders are born-that there is a genetic factor to leadership. That’s nonsense; in fact, the opposite is true. Leadersare made rather than born.
author: Warren G. Bennis

quote: There are certain people in your life and work where the relationship is more important than who is right or wrong.
author: Al Ritter

quote: The mediocre leader tells. The good leader explains. The superior leader demonstrates. The great leader inspires.
author: Gary Patton

quote: True Leaders don't create followers, they create more leaders
author: Ziad K. Abdelnour, Economic Warfare: Secrets of Wealth Creation in the Age of Welfare Politics

quote: The captain of a ship can run a great ship, but he can't do anything about the tides.
author: Matthew Norman, Domestic Violets
category: captain, leaders, leadership, politician, politics, ship, tides

quote: I'm not the boss of my house. I don't know how I lost it, I don't know when I lost it, I don't really think I ever had it. But I've seen the boss's job...and I don't want it!
author: Bill Cosby, Himself
category: family, family-relationship, family-relationships, fatherhood, fathers, leaders, leadership

quote: Many people read History books but it takes just a few people to LEAD the cause that will shape the course of HISTORY.
author: Fela Durotoye
category: africa, history, inspirational, leaders, leadership, people

quote: The best leaders want to leverage all the capabilities of the people in their organization.
author: Mark      Miller, The Heart of Leadership: Becoming a Leader People Want to Follow

quote: You can lead with or without a title. If you wait until you get a title, you may wait forever.
author: Mark      Miller, The Heart of Leadership: Becoming a Leader People Want to Follow

quote: Decision-making is a skill. Wisdom is a leadership trait.
author: Mark      Miller, The Heart of Leadership: Becoming a Leader People Want to Follow

quote: If you’re a serious minded leader, you will read. You will read all you can. You will read when you feel like it, and you will read when you don’t. You will do whatever you have to do to increase your leadership input, because you know as well as I do that it will make you better.
author: Bill Hybels, Axiom: Powerful Leadership Proverbs

quote: Reasons are the spoils of victory. When you've destroyed the enemy, then your leaders write down the reasons in books, and give moving speeches about them. If you've done your job, then there aren't any of the enemy left to dispute your leader's reasons. At least not until the next war.
author: Terry Goodkind, Blood of the Fold

quote: Richard rubbed his temples. He had a headache from lack of sleep. "Don't you understand? This isn't about conquering lands and taking things from others; this is about fighting oppression."The general rested a boot on the gilded rung of a chair and hooked a thumb behind his wide belt. "I don't see much difference. From my experience, the Master Rahl always thinks he knows best, and always wants to rule the world. You are your father's son. War is war. Reasons make no difference to us; we fight because we are told to, same as those on the other side. Reasons mean little to a man swinging his sword, trying to keep his head.
author: Terry Goodkind, Blood of the Fold

quote: The old world was destroyed because of its own greed and secretiveness. Those least evolved rose to the top, as happens here. Your leaders, as you call them, are all people with damaged senses of self-worth. The damaged goods run the civilization. That’s why it cannot last." "Abraham Lincoln was damaged goods?""The need to lead is a symptom.
author: Whitley Strieber, The Key: A True Encounter

quote: Senior pastors cannot be those who think they can do everything but are willing to let a few people help them. Rather, they are those who know they can’t do everything, don’t want to do everything, and are not willing to do everything; they welcome others to come along-side with their gifts in order to form a powerful team for Christ.
author: Sue Mallory

quote: There are no perfect leaders.
author: Max McKeown, Adaptability: The Art of Winning in an Age of Uncertainty

quote: Winners hate losing more than changing while others hate changing more than losing.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: Great charismatic leaders don't just say what voters want to hear
author: they say what voters want to say.

quote: To get leaders to become stakeholders in ministry and to understand the DNA of your church, you must invest in them, equip them, and raise the bar of accountability.
author: Sue Mallory, Equipping Church, The
category: accountability, dna, equip, leaders, ministry, stakeholders

quote: I have learnt from the politics of my great country, Nigeria that there is nothing wrong with the heads of states, but there is something wrong with the state of the heads.
author: Ogwo David Emenike
category: leaders, leadership, mindset, nigeria, ogwo-david-emenike, politics

quote: We are attempting to build, within our movement, non-exploitative ways of relating to one another based on trust and concern rather than political expediency. We have serious personal/political intentions in breaking down hierarchical and elitist structures, and for experimenting with leaderless groups and collective decision making. In dealing with the media these revolutionary principles and practices are destroyed. The media works to create leaders, it knows no way of relating to us on our own terms. Being interviewed and presented as a leader is a real ego trip--the media brings out the most counter-revolutionary traits in people. Elitism, dissension and division are the ultimate results.
author: Nancy Ferro

quote: Voice is not just the sound that comes from your throat, but the feelings that come from your words.
author: Jennifer Donnelly, A Northern Light

quote: The only way to get what you want is to make them more afraid of you than they are of each other.
author: Cinda Williams Chima, The Crimson Crown

quote: In a world of words, anything is possible...
author: Laura Wright LaRoche

quote: Words themselves aren't that important. Even if somebody says words that shock you, or make you want to kill them, or make you tremble with emotion, the words themselves you tend to forget in time. Words are just tools we use to express or communicate something.
author: Ryū Murakami, Popular Hits of the Showa Era

quote: If I disagree with you sometimes, it's because I have a mind of my own.
author: Emma Paul

quote: Be true to your teeth and they won't be false to you.
author: Soupy Sales

quote: Barbara wanted to go to tea at Dorchester as much as she wanted to give birth to octuplets.
author: Elizabeth  George, Believing the Lie

quote: You are the Jehovah of goodness, Allah of brotherhood, Buddha of reasoning and Krishna of love. And that’s more than enough gods, that the world will ever need.
author: Abhijit Naskar, 7 Billion Gods: Humans Above All
category: brainy-quotes, humanism, humanist, humanitarian, humans-are-god, inner-divinity, service-to-humanity, words-of-wisdom

quote: Patriotism or Nationalism without reasoning is what I call “Nationalist Fundamentalism”, which is as dangerous as “Religious Fundamentalism”.
author: Abhijit Naskar, I Am The Thread: My Mission
category: brainy-quotes, conscience, fundamentalism, group-loyalty, harmony, human-progress, humanism, nationalism, nationalist, nationalist-fundamentalism, patriotism, patriotism-quotes, philosophy, prejudices, rational-thinking, reasoning, religious-fundamentalism, supremacy, words-of-wisdom

quote: How well it was said," answered the fisherman, "that swords can be kept off with shields but the Eye of Wisdom pierces through every defense!
author: C.S. Lewis, The Horse and His Boy

quote: Words are seeds. They grow with time. Wisdom is to plant in your mind words that you desire to harvest.
author: Grace Penuel

quote: Quoting Shakespeare doesn't make you an intellectual. It just makes you a fan of Shakespeare.
author: Kevin N. Fair

quote: Words are the writer's sorcery, our dark arts and our sleight of hand. They're our enchantment and our temptation
author: Karl Wiggins, Self-Publishing In the Eye of the Storm
category: words-of-wisdom, writing, writing-advice, writing-books, writing-craft, writing-from-the-heart, writing-inspiration, writing-process, writing-quotes

quote: The quality of a man is not determined by the opinions that others hold of him, nor by the opinions that he holds of himself. The quality of a man is determined only by his actions and the choices that he makes. Only that and that alone.
author: C. JoyBell C.
category: actions-over-words, man-s-character, opinions, quality-of-a-man, truth, words-of-wisdom, worth-of-a-man

quote: Don't ruin the moment by saying something stupid. There's elegance in things left unsaid.
author: Kurtis J. Wiebe, Peter Panzerfaust, Vol. 2: Hooked

quote: Sometimes the answer is in the question.
author: Cristina Smith, The Word Search Oracle- Yoga for the Brain™
category: inspirational, made-me-think, metaphysical-truth-reality, philosophical-musings, ponder-this, words-of-wisdom

quote: God doesn’t help anyone, humans do.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Film Testament
category: brainy-quotes, god, helping-hand, helping-others, humanism, humanity, service-to-others, social-reform, wise-sayings, words-of-wisdom

quote: No matter how big a hen's hut is, it must bow to enter
author: Ikechukwu Joseph

quote: Entertain, but also, give the viewer something to think about.
author: Abhijit Naskar, The Film Testament
category: acting, acting-life-actress, actor, actor-quotes, actors, actress, brainy-quotes, cinema, cinematography, director-be-film, film, film-director, film-industry, film-makers, film-making, film-script, filming, filmmaking, films, inspirational, model, modeling, movie, movie-making, movie-quote, movie-quotes, movies, social-psychology, wisdom, words-of-wisdom

quote: Every person is bound to make the first impression with the help of words
author: Bhavik Sarkhedi

quote: When a word of God is spoken it will always be personal and yet we will find it touching the lives of others in some most amazing ways
author: John M Sheehan

quote: My favorite alphabet is 'R'. It has got: Revenge, Racism, Reincarnation, Renaissance, Revival and Resurgence.
author: Bhavik Sarkhedi

quote: If you're gonna catch fire
author: you better love my heat.

quote: O, the sheer magnificence of words that come together like waves upon a beach, each telling its own story is a life worthy to be read
author: John M Sheehan

quote: Qualia of God refers to the private subjective experience or conception of God in people.
author: Abhijit Naskar, What is Mind?
category: god, inspiration, neuroscience, neurotheology, qualia, religion, science-and-religion, truth, truth-quotes, wisdom-quotations, words-of-wisdom

quote: My past is ahead of me because I am beyond my past.
author: Steven Cuoco
category: best-inspirational-quotes, brainy-quote, famous-quotes, inspirational-quotes, quotes-about-life, words-of-wisdom

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: The future is terrifying because it's full of stuff, not because it's empty.
author: Alexis  Hall, For Real

quote: Love doesn't just go away when it becomes inconvenient.
author: Alexis  Hall, For Real

quote: It's not what you do, it's what it means.
author: Alexis  Hall, For Real

quote: You should learn how say things with your eyes that others waste time putting into words,
author: Eyden I., Kiss Friendzone Goodbye

quote: Everything in its own time. If your time is not right now, your right now may be soon.
author: Steven Cuoco

quote: Every word that I utter matters and this makes me speechless.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: The truth actually lies mostly in three words - God bless you, I love you, I adore you, I trust you, I believe you, I mistrust you, and finally God curse you, I hate you and talak talak talak. Only the frauds and politicians speak beyond the three truthful words.
author: Amit Abraham

quote: under the lighthouse there's always darkness
author: Tsukasa Hojo, Cat's Eye, Vol. 4

quote: Your tongue holds your fate, and your fingers drive you to it.
author: Elie Chansa

quote: In the furnace of fire, gold and silver are refined.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: A person’s voice can have such a powerful experience on the listener, very different from looking at the words on the page.
author: Frank Beddor

quote: I love books. I love that moment when you can open one and sink into it. You can escape from the world, into a story that's way more interesting than yours will ever be.
author: Elizabeth Scott

quote: Style is art and fashion is everything. Personal expression should reflect the best of who you are and respected without being misunderstood.
author: Steven Cuoco
category: brainy-quotes, brainyquote-com, inspirational-quotes, quote-of-the-day, words-of-wisdom, words-to-inspire-you, words-to-live-by

quote: If hunger could please God, millions hadn't starved to death.
author: Syed Arshad, If It's Not Love

quote: People don't care what you name it, G. They like pie for what's on the inside.
author: Kat Yeh

quote: Words that comes out of your mouth describes you character and personalty
author: "Beta" Metani' Marashi

quote: Do not believe in anything simply because you have heard it. Do not believe in anything simply because it is spoken and rumored by many. Do not believe in anything simply because it is found written in your religious books. But after observation and analysis, when you find that anything agrees with reason and is conducive to the good and benefit of one and all, then accept it and live up to it.
author: Guatama Buddha

quote: A woman who's self confident doesn't need to compete with other females. She knows her worth and lives a purpose filled life.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Sweet Destiny
category: freedom, hapoiness, inspirational-quotes, life, love, peace, quotes, quotes-and-saying, truth, words-of-wisdom, words-to-live-by

quote: Sure, stories can be like a fire on a cold night. But they can burn too. There ain't nothin' can cut deeper or sting with more poison than words can.
author: Ellery Adams, Poisoned Prose

quote: You get one chance.You get to do this thing one time and you don’t even know when it goes from swirling forward and around and around in circles to just a plain cold stop and nothing more. Can you believe it? All this time I’ve spent weighing this and weighing that, worrying about this and worrying about that, living back then and living forward, caring about what so-and-so thinks and about so-and-so, too, but never living here, here, this moment here. Never even acknowledging that this moment even exists, and it hits me, like a live volt through the chest.This moment here.This is all you get.Before you are part of the sky
author: Andrea Portes, Anatomy of a Misfit

quote: A book is not just a collection of words, it is a perception portrayed on blank sheets. You know, getting you the feelings of blowing winds and rains and sun and flowers around, the smiles, the tears, the notional links with the characters and make them all alive, while you read. And that's sure as hell a gruelling task !
author: Syed Arshad

quote: You don't 'love' people when they are 'nice'. Don't you see that's the same as saying 'what's in it for me'?
author: Jerzy Pilch, The Mighty Angel
category: genuine-love, genuineness, love, people-relations, unselfishness, words-of-wisdom

quote: The hangover: such a cure, she thinks, for overthinking.
author: Naomi Wood, Mrs. Hemingway

quote: Many have came before you and many will come after you, but none will ever be you. Some may even try to duplicate your characteristics, but they'll never succeed because you are unique.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink
category: characteristics-of-leadership, faith, hope, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, philosophy, truth, uniqueness, words-of-wisdom

quote: Half of wisdom is love and friendship with people.(the other half is to guard yourself against the evils of people)
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: The more you read, the harder it is to condemn.
author: Glen Duncan

quote: If we have touched another's life with our action and through our words then we have lived.
author: Aisha Mirza

quote: A picture may describe a 1000 words but it will often need 1000 words to describe a picture.
author: Chloe Thurlow, Katie in Love

quote: We have nothing to speak about. There never was. Words are an unnecessary trouble. Expression is time wasting away. Any communication is just a yelp in the darkness. I am speaking now but I am saying nothing. I am just making noises, and, as it happens, they are organized in words and you should not draw meaning from this.
author: Cecil Baldwin
category: cecil-baldwin, cecil-gershwin, inspirational, jeffrey-cranor, joseph-fink, podcast, tumblr, welcome-to-night-vale, words-of-wisdom, wtnv

quote: No one should let yesterday use up too much of today. Easy to say, hard to live.
author: Andrea Hairston, Redwood and Wildfire

quote: The point is, stories can be all lengths. Never underestimate the power of “less is more.
author: Darynda Jones

quote: Word – An eternal power,In a wrong place at a wrong time,Inflicts more pain than a weapon
author: Samir Satam, Postcards From Memory

quote: Sometimes, authors' descriptions of unique fictional characters are like mirrors that reflect the readers image back.
author: Ben Abix
